publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2595 Karen Gillon: Equal Opportunities Commission Scotland’s "Pregnant and Productive" Campaign—That the Parliament acknowledges a recent study by the Equal Opportunities Commission which shows that every year in the United Kingdom around 30,000 working women are sacked, made redundant, leave their jobs or miss out on pay or promotion due to pregnancy; supports the Equal Opportunities Commission Scotland’s "Pregnant and Productive" campaign, and urges the Scottish Executive to do what it can to end the discrimination against pregnant women in the workplace.
S2M-2595 Equal Opportunities Commission Scotland’s "Pregnant and Productive" Campaign (lodged on 15 March 2005) Margaret Jamieson*, Tommy Sheridan*

S2M-2595 Karen Gillon: Equal Opportunities Commission Scotland’s "Pregnant and Productive" Campaign—That the Parliament acknowledges a recent study by the Equal Opportunities Commission which shows that every year in the United Kingdom around 30,000 working women are sacked, made redundant, leave their jobs or miss out on pay or promotion due to pregnancy; supports the Equal Opportunities Commission Scotland’s "Pregnant and Productive" campaign, and urges the Scottish Executive to do what it can to end the discrimination against pregnant women in the workplace. Supported by: Margaret Jamieson, Tommy Sheridan
S2M-2595 Equal Opportunities Commission Scotland’s "Pregnant and Productive" Campaign (lodged on 15 March 2005) Susan Deacon*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2595 Equal Opportunities Commission Scotland’s “Pregnant and Productive” Campaign (lodged on 15 March 2005) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-2595 Equal Opportunities Commission Scotland’s “Pregnant and Productive” Campaign (lodged on 15 March 2005) Nora Radcliffe*, Patrick Harvie*, Janis Hughes*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Michael McMahon*, Mr John Swinney*, Brian Adam*, Stewart Stevenson*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Cathie Craigie*, Alex Neil*, Trish Godman*, Rosie Kane*, Robin Harper*, Eleanor Scott*

S2M-2595 Equal Opportunities Commission Scotland’s “Pregnant and Productive” Campaign (lodged on 15 March 2005) Jackie Baillie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mike Watson*, Karen Whitefield*, Shiona Baird*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-2595 Equal Opportunities Commission Scotland’s “Pregnant and Productive” Campaign (lodged on 15 March 2005) Chris Ballance*, Cathy Peattie*, Elaine Smith*, Sarah Boyack*, Mr Mark Ruskell*
S2M-2595 Equal Opportunities Commission Scotland’s "Pregnant and Productive" Campaign (lodged on 15 March 2005) Maureen Macmillan*
